page.title: 11CRICKET AT SPETISBURY
page.content: Prior to 1934 cricket and soccer had been played in fields within and adjoining the "Crawford Castle" hill fort. Mr Tory (father of the present owner) created a village sportsfield "The Meadows" on an island in the River Stour. Marle, special soil for the cricket square, was brought by rail from Nottingham to Blandford then by horse and cart to Spetisbury. The ground fell into disuse in the 195O's, but in 1967 cricket was restarted by a group of villagers. Improvements made include the erection of a pavillion in 1977. The club now has over 3O members and cricket is played on Saturdays and Sundays throughout the summer. Many of the matches are against neighbouring villages and feature the atmosphere of friendly village rivallry.
